@graph.rdfs:comment: Samples contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. A Sample is a material entity taken from a larger source, system, or environment, collected for the purpose of analysis, testing, identification, or demonstration. The NIAID Data Ecosystem Discovery Portal harvests metadata from repositories and harmonizes them to this schema to enable easy cross-platform sample searching and filtering.
@graph.rdfs:label: Sample

associatedPhenotype.description: one or more observable traits or conditions relevant to the source of the sample.

associatedGenotype.description: One or more genetic variants or molecular features observed or inferred from the sample.

cellType.description: The type of cell represented in or derived from the biological sample, based on morphology, lineage, or molecular markers.

anatomicalSystem.description: Indicate the anatomical system from which the sample is collect, e.g. circulatory, digestive, endocrine, immune and other systems.

anatomicalStructure.description: Indicate the organ, tissues the sample was collected from.

sex.description: The biological sex of the individual from which the sample was obtained.

developmentalStage.description: A temporal subdivision of a developmental process, indicating the age or stage of the object when the sample was created.

bioChemInteraction.description: A BioChemEntity that is known to interact with this item.

biologicalRole.description: A role played by the BioChemEntity within a biological context.

isInvolvedInBiologicalProcess.description: Biological process this BioChemEntity is involved in; please use PropertyValue if you want to include any evidence.

identifier.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of [[Thing]], such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#identifierBg) for more details.

sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

alternateIdentifier.description: An additional identifier for the same instance of the resource.

citation.description: List publications where the sample is mentioned or described.

collectionMethod.description: Provide information about the conditions and methods of acquisition of samples.

collector.description: The Person or Organization who collected the Sample.

conditionsOfAccess.description: Sample access statement outlining conditions/requirements need to be fulfilled before access to the sample is granted.

contributor.description: Person or organization that contributes to the work.

dateCollected.description: The date on which the sample was collected.

dateCreated.description: The date the sample was created or added to a DataFeed.

dateModified.description: Date sample record was last updated.

dateProcessed.description: The date the sample was processed or used in a method.

datePublished.description: The date when the  record of the sample will be made publicly available.

environmentalSystem.description: A category or description of the habitat that describes elements of an ecosystem where the sample was collected. Where possible use controlled vocabulary such as ENVO.

experimentalPurpose.description: Describe the planned or executed experimental procedures involving the samples.

hasPart.description: Describe related items including other resources related to the samples.

instrument.description: Provide description of instruments and devices used in collecting, processing and analysis of samples.

isPartOf.description: Describe related items including other resources related to the samples.

isRelatedTo.description: Describe related items including other resources related to the samples.

keywords.description: Terms that capture the main subjects e.g. cancer, plant biology.

locationOfOrigin.description: The location from which the sample was originally collected.

maintainer.description: The Person or Organization who is responsible for the Sample.

sampleAvailability.description: Indicate whether this resource is available for reuse.

sampleProcess.description: The processing technique that was applied to the sample, methods used to prepare the samples.

sampleQuantity.description: A numeric value for a measurement of the size  of a sample.

sampleState.description: Specify the composition and state of the sample, indicating which form it exisits in, e.g. gas, liquid, solid.

sampleStorageTemperature.description: The temperature at which the sample is stored.

@graph.rdfs:comment: one or more observable traits or conditions relevant to the source of the sample.
@graph.rdfs:label: associatedPhenotype

@graph.rdfs:comment: One or more genetic variants or molecular features observed or inferred from the sample.
@graph.rdfs:label: associatedGenotype

@graph.rdfs:comment: The type of cell represented in or derived from the biological sample, based on morphology, lineage, or molecular markers.
@graph.rdfs:label: cellType
